lines.text: December 1965. Is that all it has been since I inherited the world? Only three years. Seems like 100 million.
There are stories being told, Bob.
By people who are out of their minds with fear.
Maybe. But there are too many to be just coincidental. Stories about people who have died and have come back.
They're stories Ben, stories.
You're freaks, all of you! All of you, freaks, mutations!
They were afraid of me... they were afraid of me... they were afraid of me.

[filling up a bag with stakes]
How many more of these will I have to make before they're all destroyed? They want my blood. Their lives are mine. I still get squimish.

[Virginia has become a vampire]
Let... me... in.
[first lines]
Another day to live through. Better get started.
But *you* lived through all this. Do you know why?
Perhaps I was chosen.
Morgan! We're going to kill you!

You can't join us. You're a monster to them. Why do you think I ran when I saw you, even though I was assigned to spy on you? Because I was so terrified, what I'd heard about you. You're a legend in the city. Moving by day, instead of night, leaving as evidence of your existence bloodless corpses. Many of the people you destroyed were still alive! Many of them were loved ones of the people in my group.
I didn't know.
You're freaks! I'm a man! The last man...

[seeing a dog]
It's alive!
Morgan, come out!
Your new society sounds charming.
You're whistling past a graveyard.
Is that a commentary on my work at the lab?
Mommy, where are you? Mommy, I can't see.
[Robert knocks on Ben's door to pick him up for work]
Who is it?
It's me, Ben! We're late!
[Ben answers the door]
Ben, what's the matter with you?
Nothing and I'm going to keep it that way.
Ben, look, let's talk about this.
There's nothing to talk about. You think I'm out of my mind. You laughed at me and my theory. You might be one of them.
Ben, look, you're ill. You ought to see a doctor.
No doctors! You take care of your life, I'll take care of mine. Now get away from here. You understand, get away from here!
[slams the door]
You're the only one who wasn't afraid to come here today.
What's going to happen, Dr. Mercer? Is everybody in the world going to die before someone finds the answer?
No, I don't think so. I don't deny there's some strange evolutionary process going on, but mankind won't be destroyed. The fact that you and I are working here today is evidence of that.
This is Robert Morgan. If somebody can hear me, answer me. For God's sake, ANSWER ME.
This is KOKW calling. KOKW calling! Answer me!
KOKW calling, come in.
[waits for a response, then changes frequency]
KOKW calling. I'm on international frequency, come in.
I can't afford the luxury of anger. Anger can make me vulnerable. It can destoy my reason and reason's the only advantage I have over them.
And I thought you were alone. I was going to cure you! Does that amuse you?
Another day... another day to start all over again.
